Sentencas: Manganites are technologically important materials, used widely as solid oxide fuel cell cathodes; they have also been shown to exhibit electroresistance.
Titulo: Imaging oxygen defects and their motion at a manganite surface

Sentencas: Oxygen bulk diffusion and surface exchange processes are critical for catalytic action, and numerous studies of manganites have linked electroresistance to electrochemical oxygen migration.
Titulo: Imaging oxygen defects and their motion at a manganite surface

Sentencas: Direct imaging of individual oxygen defects is needed to underpin understanding of these important processes.
Titulo: Imaging oxygen defects and their motion at a manganite surface

Sentencas: Currently, it is not possible to collect the required images in bulk, but scanning tunnelling microscopy (STM) could provide such data for surfaces.
Titulo: Imaging oxygen defects and their motion at a manganite surface

Sentencas: Here, we report the first atomic resolution images of oxygen defects at a manganite surface.
Titulo: Imaging oxygen defects and their motion at a manganite surface

Sentencas: Our experiments also reveal defect dynamics, including oxygen adatom migration, vacancy-adatom recombination and adatom bistability.
Titulo: Imaging oxygen defects and their motion at a manganite surface

Sentencas: Beyond providing an experimental basis for testing models describing the microscopics of oxygen migration at transition-metal oxide interfaces, our work resolves the long-standing puzzle of why STM is more challenging for layered manganites than for cuprates.
Titulo: Imaging oxygen defects and their motion at a manganite surface
